posts.name: Eric1
posts.cooked:
Machine: Omio X8-2200L

I am using the mach3 that can be found in the WCP assembly guide.

We just finished assembling our machine I plugged in the usb coord to my computer and clicked reset

When I attempt to jog by clicking the arrow keys nothing happens

Is there a way of telling if the cnc is actually connected to my laptop?

posts.name: Anand Rajamani
posts.cooked: Is everything turned on? When you reset, do you see no error message blinking?

Eric1:

Is there a way of telling if the cnc is actually connected to my laptop?

Are the switches on the black controller on? When I plug mine into my laptop it does get recognized as a USB device.

posts.name: FrankJ
posts.cooked:
I forget the specifics, but the Mach 3 software will throw an error code if it does not see the controller. On first guess the software starts in E-stop mode and that has to be reset.

Also the Mach 3 has to be properly configured for the Omio. Simplest to use the version downloaded from WCP or Omio.

posts.name: Jerry Krist - Lead Mentor FRC Team 1792
posts.cooked: We are setting up our new Omio too and we are trying to find the OMIO stepper motor and ball screw specs so we can determine the travel count per inch.  Can anyone help with this?
posts.display_username: Jerry Krist - Lead Mentor FRC Team 1792

reply_to_user.name: Jerry Krist - Lead Mentor FRC Team 1792

posts.name: Benjamen Johnson
posts.cooked: Is it not jogging at all or just very very slowly? At least for incremental jogging you have to set the feed rate.

suggested_topics.title: Swerve module physically unable to drive and rotate at the same time
suggested_topics.excerpt: All the coaxial swerves have an interaction between rotating and steering. IE, steering causes the wheel to rotate a bit. Just bake it into your programming
